h1: How Many Calories in a Peanut Butter and Jam Sandwich?
assumptions: 2 slices white bread (about 28g each), 2 tbsp creamy peanut butter (32g), 1 tbsp grape jam (20g), assembled without added butter or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, peanut butter brand, jam sweetness, portion sizes, and preparation. Check labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A standard peanut butter and jam sandwich contains about 400 calories with 12g protein and 50g carbs.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white
Opt for natural peanut butter (no added sugar/oil)

faqs.q: How many calories in a peanut butter and jam sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 400 calories for a standard version with 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp PB, and 1 tbsp jam.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a PB&J sandwich?
faqs.a: About 12g protein, mainly from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: Does jam add a lot of sugar to the sandwich?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tbsp jam adds around 10-15g sugars; choose low-sugar options to reduce.

faqs.q: How to make a lower-calorie PB&J?
faqs.a: Use thin-sliced bread, 1 tbsp PB, and sugar-free jam to drop it under 300 calories.

faqs.q: Is a peanut butter and jelly sandwich healthy?
faqs.a: It provides protein and fats but is high in carbs and sugars; opt for whole grains and natural ingredients for better nutrition.
